div.div: Academics
Alumni
District
Contact Us
School Board
Below you will find a list of resources and links. These sites can be helpful to those looking for a way to stay academically active while school is closed.

td.style: width: 89.75pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: The United School District’s Goal is to provide all students with Continuity of Education for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, as it is important that students have the opportunity to maintain and develop skills while away from the customary school environment.

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: The District will engage students through Planned Instruction by providing formal teaching and learning similar to that which occurs in a classroom setting. Within this process teachers use planned courses of instruction on new concepts/skills aligned to grade level standards. Teacher assess the learning of their students and make adjustments to instruction based upon student progress. In order to receive grade and credit, students must attend regularly and complete the course requirements.
Planned Instruction will begin on April 16, 2020.
Prior to this date, students were engaged in Enrichment and Review activities that reinforced and extended their prior learning.

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: Students will engage with activities as defined through the work assigned by their teacher(s). Students are to complete the work independently, however, teachers will be available each day during regular school hours, beginning March 30, 2020. Completed work will be returned to the teacher no later than June 4, 2020.

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: The District will be providing communication through the District website and Facebook pages, as well as delivering messages through our SchoolMessenger service that reaches all families. Mailings to all families are also a way that we are communicating with those in our District.

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: Students will be completing assignments via computer or paper/pencil. Information regarding the assignments are mailed to each family. And, packets are mailed to those who do not have internet or lack internet connectivity/accessibility in their homes/area.

table.style: border-collapse: collapse; border: none; margin-left: 7.85pt; margin-right: 7.85pt

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: Teachers will communicate with their students regarding the assignments. Communication will be done via phone, email, Remind, and/or Google Classroom. Teachers are expected to be working each school day, during regular school hours.
Teachers will respond to student questions during regular school hours.
Teachers will limit the amount of work assigned during this unprecedented crisis.

table.style: border-collapse: collapse; border: none; margin-left: 7.85pt; margin-right: 7.85pt

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: Students will complete assignments that were provided by their teachers.
Students are encouraged to reach out to their teachers for help or to have their questions answered during regular school hours.

table.style: border-collapse: collapse; border: none; margin-left: 7.85pt; margin-right: 7.85pt

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: Students will be considered present and participating and completing assignments each school day, unless the school receives notification from the parent/guardian that the student is absent from instruction that day.

table.style: border-collapse: collapse; border: none; margin-left: 7.85pt; margin-right: 7.85pt

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.p: Good Faith Efforts for Access and Equity for All Students

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: The United School District Board of Directors, Administration, Faculty and Staff are putting forth their Good Faith Efforts in providing educational access and equity for all student.

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: Administrators, Teachers, and Paraprofessionals will be collaborating with general education teachers in providing support to students with disabilities.
Special Education Teachers and their Paraprofessionals will continue to differentiate instruction, making adaptations and accommodations, through communications with their students.

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: English Language Learner supports will be provided by those teachers who support specific students identified in need of these services.

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt
td.p: Students identified as Gifted Learners will be supported by those teachers who support them during the normal, regular school day.

table.style: border-collapse: collapse; border: none; margin-left: 7.85pt; margin-right: 7.85pt

td.style: width: 467.5pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; background: #D9E2F3; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

United Elementary School – Mr. Lewis Kindja, Principal 814-446-5615 x 1313
Director of Education – Mrs. Patricia Berezansky 814-446-5615 x 3305

div.div: Khan Academy - https://www.khanacademy.org/ Various courses and practice for all gradesEverFi - https://everfi.com/k-12/parent-remote-learning/ - a one-stop-shop for families to use EVERFI resources directly with students.
First in Math - https://www.firstinmath.com/ - grades K-6 - Each United Elementary student has a login to First in Math
National Geographic for Kids - https://kids.nationalgeographic.com/ - grades K-6 - Interactive National Geographic

K-2 Read aloud -https://freeresources.amplify.com/ckla-k-2/?utm_campaign=FY20_HQIM&utm_source=hs_email&utm_medium=email&utm_content=86563395&_hsenc=p2ANqtz--YJsOoTdnPgUk1Do5WSmQf5bfPxixE4TXXsfvM2SlgDEULXyN2weSa8-JE8TeRIxDfrbjUktJkdA26pJms3p82gIGLzA&_hsmi=86563395

SmartMusic software for Mr. Nelson's Band Class - https://admin.smartmusic.com/join - create a SmartMusic account and join the class using this code: 23VX6-YEEJX.
Epic - https://www.getepic.com/ - grades K-6 - Read Amazing Books online, Free 30 day trial
Kahoot! Play & Create Quizzes - Always free for teachers and students, Kahoot! lets users take, create, and host quizzes. Find and take Kahoots on virtually any topic.
Scholastic - https://classroommagazines.scholastic.com/support/learnathome.html?caching - free ebooks and videos
No Red Ink - https://www.noredink.com/signup -grades 4-12 - Free Interactive Writing
12 Free Museum Tours - https://www.msn.com/en-us/travel/travel-trivia/stuck-at-home-these-12-famous-museums-offer-virtual-tours-you-can-take-on-your-couch-video - All Grades - Virtual Museum Tours

123homeschool4me - https://www.123homeschool4me.com/ - grades K-8 - Worksheets and activities for grades K-8
2Simple - https://2simple.com/blog/using-purple-mash-when-school-closed/ - grades k-6 - Open-ended tools, spelling, grammar, math and cross-curricular projects
Adventure2Learning - https://www.adventureacademy.com/ grades K-6 - 2 Months free for all families affected with code LEARN60
BedTimeMath - http://bedtimemath.org/ - Grades K-6 - Families can also download our free Bedtime Math app on iOS and Android, which delivers a fun new math problem every day for families to do together and is proven to boost kids’ math skills.
Code.org - https://studio.code.org/projects/public- Grades K-12 - Coding resources and activities
ABC Mouse - https://www.abcmouse.com/ - grades K-2 - Use code = SCHOOL6739
Adventure Academy - https://www.adventureacademy.com/ - grades 3-8 - Use Code = SCHOOL6739
Reading IQ - https://www.readingiq.com/ - an advanced reading resource through grade 6 - Use Code = SCHOOL6739
Cincinnati Zoo - https://www.facebook.com/cincinnatizoo/ Visit the Cincinnati zoo Facebook page daily at 3:00 p.m. for a visit to one of the exhibits and an activity.
Wonderopolis - http://www.wonderopolis.org/ - elementary - great resources for reading and learning
Tinkercad - https://www.tinkercad.com/ for students who want to work on 3D design/3D printing.
BeanBeanBean - https://beanbeanbean.com/ has a variety of subjects. All correct answers donate food to end world hunger.
FreeRice.com - https://freerice.com/ same idea as BeanBeanBean. No Log-in required.
Census School Resources - https://census.gov/schools - activities for students
Kids Activities - https://kidsactivitiesblog.com/ - Fun things to do with your child
30 Virtual Field Trips For FREE - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SvIdgTx9djKO6SjyvPDsoGlkgE3iExmi3qh2KRRku_w/mobilebasic
Spelling City - http://spellingcity.com/ open for first-grade students
Switcheroo Zoo - https://www.switchzoo.com/ - Fun Animal Games
Fun Brain - https://www.funbrain.com/games - online games
PBS Kids - https://pbskids.org/ - games and resources
Into the Book https://reading.ecb.org/ - activities for kids
Star Fall - https://www.starfall.com/h/ - PreK -3 - activities
Suessville - https://www.seussville.com/ - Dr. Suess activities
Storyline Online - https://www.storylineonline.net/ - story activities
ABC YA - https://www.abcya.com/ - learning games and apps
Highlights Kids - https://www.highlightskids.com/ - Highlights activities
I Know it - https://www.iknowit.com/ - elementary resources
Discovery Education - Virtual Field Trips - https://www.discoveryeducation.com/community/virtual-field-trips/
Smithsonian Science Center - https://www.ssec.si.edu/explore-our-curriculum-resources?f%5B0%5D=field_is_free%3A1- Free hands-on STEM Activities
BrainPop - http://www.brainpop.com/ - great resource for all subjects
Wide Open Schools : https://wideopenschool.org/ - free online learning and explorations
Exploratorium - https://click.icptrack.com/icp/relay.php?r=28531405&msgid=400421&act=BOS2&c=1532686&destination=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.exploratorium.edu%2F%3F%3DExploratorium

The Free Library of Philadelphia - https://click.icptrack.com/icp/relay.php?r=28531405&msgid=400421&act=BOS2&c=1532686&destination=https%3A%2F%2Flibwww.freelibrary.org%2Fblog%2Fpost%2F4116
The National Constitution Center - https://click.icptrack.com/icp/relay.php?r=28531405&msgid=400421&act=BOS2&c=1532686&destination=https%3A%2F%2Fconstitutioncenter.org%2F
Nike Training Club - Try free fitness videos in categories like “Workouts in Small Spaces.” Use AirPlay with your Apple TV for an immersive experience.

Peloton - You don’t need a Peloton (or any equipment, actually) to get in a great workout. Choose from tons of HIIT cardio, yoga, and stretching classes.
Marco Polo - Stay In Touch - Made for family and friends rather than followers, Marco Polo is a private messaging app. Send videos and texts without likes, hearts—or ads.
FaceTime - Make video or audio calls from your iPhone, iPad, or Mac through your Apple ID or phone number. Enjoy Group FaceTime with up to 32 people at once.
Exploratorium - https://click.icptrack.com/icp/relay.php?r=28531405&msgid=400421&act=BOS2&c=1532686&destination=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.exploratorium.edu%2F%3F%3DExploratorium
